item.title: Why is there so many ex staff members on this forum
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:12, topic:548995”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=667903.msg4467004#msg4467004 date=1420671749]
Because being a staff member here is like voluntarily posting on Youtube comments.
[/quote]
Yeh, even an idiot can be an administrator.[/quote]
Yeah, you said it!

On a serious note though, there are so many ex staff because this community is actually quite old. It’s natural that over the years people will come and go. Some of us are a little more attached than others though and didn’t really leave permanently.
I stepped down because I was busy with work and university at the time.

EDIT: inb4 reddit.com/r/exstaffcirclejerk

Read full topic

item.title: Why is there so many ex staff members on this forum
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

zuppers:

Staff which break the rules and get their ranked revoked don’t get the ex-staff badge.

i broke rules but stepped down before…

TOM???

i pretty much ran MSCP and this is how i get treated :mad:

Read full topic
item.source: Why is there so many ex staff members on this forum

item.title: Why is there so many ex staff members on this forum
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

PaulT:

You probably see more of those people posting than others, so it looks like there are a lot of former staff. The active community members who have been here a while are for the most part helpful, so most of us have helped out moderating at some point or another (back when there were two sites, there were alot more moderator positions).

At one point I believe we had 3 sites.

Read full topic

item.title: Why is there so many ex staff members on this forum
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

They step down from being moderators or administrators. From my understanding moderators aren’t “fired” the only time they are demoted is when they abuse their powers. Which that rarely happens.

Read full topic
